org.jetel.hadoop.service

Interface HadoopConnectingService<T extends AbstractHadoopConnectionData>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.io.Closeable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    HadoopConnectingFileSystemService, HadoopConnectingMapReduceService

    public interface HadoopConnectingService<T extends AbstractHadoopConnectionData>
extends java.io.Closeable

    Defines service that can connect to Hadoop cluster and communicate with the cluster, optionally performing operations on the cluster. This interface only describes ability to connect to the cluster. It is meant to be inherited to provide definition of specific operations.

    This service must be connected before it can provide any useful operation. As that connection may fail due to external factors instances of this interface should not be used if such a failure is not expected. Specifically, instances of this interface are only meant to be used from engine. Separated services that do not extend this interface should be created for use from designer.

    Since:
    rel-3-4-0-M2

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        void connect(T connectionData,
           java.util.Properties additionalSettings)
             throws java.io.IOException

        Connects to one or more Hadoop master nodes (typically namenode, jobtracker or both). Must be called before any other operation that require connection to Hadoop cluster are performed on instance of HadoopConnectingService.

        Implementors should ensure that additional settings specified by additionalSettings parameter do not take priority to connection settings contained in connectionData parameter. That is by default if the same setting is specified by both parameters then value specified by connectionData overrides value specified by additionalSettings. However this behaviour can be changed by implementors if desired.

        Parameters:
        connectionData - Non null object containing at least information necessary to establish connection.
        additionalSettings - Non null additional settings of connection to Hadoop cluster.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If communication with master node fails.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If called twice or more times.

      • validateConnection

        java.lang.String validateConnection()
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Validates connection to Hadoop cluster established by HadoopConnectingService#connect(Properties).
        Returns:
        null if validation was successful, non-null message describing validation failure reason otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If communication with cluster fails. In such case connection should also be considered invalid.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If isConnected() returns false.

      • isConnected

        boolean isConnected()
        Gets connection status of this HadoopConnectingService. Returns true if it is connected to some Hadoop cluster.
        Returns:
        true if HadoopConnectingService#connect(Properties) has been called successfully and Closeable.close() has not been called yet, false otherwise.
